result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kymare I Johnson

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Kymare I Johnson in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Kymare I Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case was set for status, but Defense requests a plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $410.50
DNA Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**Forfeiture of the Firearm.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 60 days. Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

Defendant qualifies for Expunction on 11/11/2024.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all fines/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant has any further violations, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Authorization to Appear;  filed by Atty. Paul Bucher

10:03 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Paul E Bucher appeared by video for Kymare I Johnson. 
Defendant Kymare I Johnson in court.  
Attorney Bucher requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Status hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on November 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to pay $50.00 per month, commencing 10-15-2022;  signed on 09-23-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III;  
**forwarded to Circuit Court Business Center on 09-23-2022 (mjs)
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
signed on 09-21-2022 and filed by Kymare Johnson;  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 09-22-2022:  granted - defendant to pay $50/month starting 10-15-2022

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

01:32 PM Defendant Kymare I Johnson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
